intro: Nototriche obcuneata var. cinerea, commonly known as the grey nototriche, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, greyish-green leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or purple in color. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
